alert.note: Alert for Colbert; Lauderdale (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued February 27 at 7:11PM CST until March 04 at 9:32AM CST by NWS Huntsville
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Alabama... Tennessee River AT Florence affecting Colbert and Lauderdale Counties. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL LATE FRIDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Tennessee River AT Florence. * WHEN...Until late Friday morning. * IMPACTS...At 21.5 feet, Water covers the parking lot of the Marina at McFarland Park...with extensive flooding occurring at the soccer fields and golf course within the park. Water is also beginning to cover the road that goes underneath U.S. Highways 43 and 72 at the new playground. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 6:15 PM CST Sunday the stage was 20.4 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 6:15 PM CST Sunday was 21.2 feet. - Forecast...The river will level off and slowly fall throughout the week. It will fall below flood stage late Thursday evening. - Flood stage is 18.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 20.8 feet on 01/10/1968. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
